title: Production-ready automotive profile + vehicle sales website with stable storage, live CMS admin, media manager, and interactions

requirements.text: Implement a production-ready Motoko backend with upgrade-safe stable persistence for all specified collections: passengerVehicles, commercialVehicles, promotions, testimonials, blogPosts, contacts, creditSimulations, adminUsers, visitorStats, mediaAssets, productLikes, productShares, articleLikes, articleComments. Data must survive canister upgrade, redeploy, and rebuild; implement canister lifecycle-safe storage with automatic restore after redeploy.

quotes:
Use STABLE PERSISTENCE ONLY.

Collections:

• passengerVehicles
• commercialVehicles
• promotions
• testimonials
• blogPosts
• contacts
• creditSimulations
• adminUsers
• visitorStats
• mediaAssets

Interaction collections:

• productLikes
• productShares
• articleLikes
• articleComments

Rules:

• Auto‑save stable
• Upgrade safe
• Redeploy safe

acceptanceCriteria: After uploading/creating sample records in each collection, a canister upgrade preserves all data and the app continues functioning without manual intervention.
After redeploy/reinstall (where state is expected to remain via stable structures in the canister lifecycle), records are restored and visible in the UI.
All collections have typed IDs, createdAt/updatedAt timestamps where applicable, and deterministic serialization in stable storage.
No content is stored only in in-memory variables without being reflected in stable persistence.

constraints: Backend must be a single Motoko actor (no multi-canister backend architecture).
All content and media persistence must be stable/upgrade-safe (no in-memory-only storage).

Do not edit files under frontend immutable paths (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui). Compose using these components/hooks instead.
Use English for any user-facing text in the build request (admin labels/buttons and public UI can be implemented in English).
No external databases or off-chain storage providers; persist inside the canister only.
No third-party authentication providers; if email/password is implemented, it must be handled within the app/backend. (Internet Identity may still be used for principal binding where appropriate.)
nonGoals: Integrations with external CMS platforms (e.g., WordPress) or third-party media CDNs.
Third-party social media API integrations beyond simple share links.
Maps/geolocation features beyond rendering a configurable Google Maps iframe embed.
